result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandro Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $40.00 plus surcharges.
Perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Perez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defts probation is extended for 1 year from 3-15-17 to 3-15-18 or until all court obligations are completed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk
Restitution ordered in the amount of $40.00
for Restitution Order filed by ADA Trigg

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Alejandro Perez, appeared with Attorney Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions and is concurrent with 16CM69.  DE is ordered to pay restitution in the amount of $40.00  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
filed by Atty. Cassi Baumgardner  kmk
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

*No Contact w/B A F (dob 9/19/98), Brittany K, or their residence, or McDonald's 3711 57th Ave.
943.20(1)(a) -Misd Theft

244 p.m.  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  Janell Thwing.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty by court.  Deft demands jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am..  $1000   Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
